vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/3c299aa4-5491-49ba-ba39-144e9f0ddcd1">YOUTH ORGANIZATIONS</keyword>         <topcClas>Charities, voluntary organisations and voluntary work - Social welfare policy and systems</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <i>National Survey of Volunteering and Charitable Giving</i> was commissioned by the Office of the Third Sector in the Cabinet Office.  The research was carried out by the National Centre for Social Research in partnership with the Institute for Volunteering Research (IVR) in 2006-2007, as a follow-up to the <i>Citizenship Survey, 2005</i> (deposited at the UKDA under SN 5367).<br> <br> The survey interviewed just over 2,700 adults in households in England.  The aim was to explore how and why people give unpaid help to organisations, and what they think of their experiences; what stops people from volunteering or giving money to charity; and how and why people give money to charity.  It builds upon IVR's <i>National Survey of Volunteering</i>, last carried out in 1997 (deposited at the UKDA under SN 3931), and provides some insights into how things have changed since then.<br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>The Helping Out survey asked about:<ul><li>nature and extent of volunteering (last 12 months and last 1-5 years)</li><li>main organisation helped</li><li>barriers to giving help</li><li>employer-supported volunteering and giving</li><li>nature and extent of charitable giving (last 4 weeks and last 12 months)</li><li>perceptions of giving</li><li>knowledge and use of tax-efficient giving methods</li><li>links between giving time and giving money</li><li>demographics</li><ul><br> </abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd>The survey asked respondents about the previous week and previous month.  Some questions also asked about the previous five years.</timePrd>         <collDate event="start" date="2006-10-01T00:00:00Z">October 2006</collDate>         <collDate event="end" date="2007-02-01T00:00:00Z">February 2007</collDate>         <nation>England</nation>         <geogUnit>Government Office Regions</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Adults aged 16 and over living in England. The sample was drawn from those respondents to the <i>Citizenship Survey, 2005</i> living in England who agreed at the time to be re-contacted for future research.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Individual (micro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Cross-sectional (one-time) study</timeMeth>         <sampProc>Multi-stage stratified random sample</sampProc>         <deviat>Achieved 2,705 cases.</deviat>         <collMode>Face-to-face interview</collMode>         <sources>           <dataSrc>The dataset contains some variables (e.g. age, sex, ethnicity and other additional variables) from the <i>Citizenship Survey, 2005</i> dataset.</dataSrc>         </sources>         <weight>Weighting used. See documentation for details.</weight>         <cleanOps>A</cleanOps>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Standard conditions of access</specPerm>         <restrctn>The depositor has specified that registration is required and standard conditions of use apply. The depositor may be informed about usage. See <a href=http://ukdataservice.ac.uk/get-data/how-to-access/conditions.aspx>terms and conditions of access</a> for further information.</restrctn>         <contact><a href=http://www.ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx>Get in touch</a></contact>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat>       <relPubl>Low, N. et al. (2007) <i>Helping Out: a National Survey of Volunteering and charitable Giving</i>,  London: Office of the Third Sector, Cabinet Office. <br> <br> Low, N. and Butt, S. (2007) <i>Helping Out: a National Study of Giving and Participation - Technical Report</i>, London: National Centre for Social Research.<br> <br></relPubl>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Description: English</othRefs>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Documentation: English</othRefs>     </othrStdyMat>   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
